image.explanation: The First Nine speaks of performing rituals to appease spirits, which is auspicious because the desire to honor ancestors remains unchanged.

lines.white_explanation: Performing rituals to appease spirits is auspicious. With such events, naturally there will be no feasting.

lines.explanation: A crane calling in the shade, its young answering. I have a good cup, I will share it with you.

image.text: Its young answering, expressing the heart's desire.
image.explanation: Young cranes responding to old cranes is an expression of hearts in accord.

lines.white_explanation: An old crane calls in the shade of trees, young cranes respond beside it. I have fine wine, I will share it with you.

lines.explanation: He finds an opponent. Sometimes drumming, sometimes stopping, sometimes weeping, sometimes singing.

image.text: Sometimes drumming, sometimes stopping, the position is inappropriate.
image.explanation: Some beat drums in pursuit, some celebrate victory, but from the line image, the Six in the Third is a yin line in a yang position, suggesting hidden dangers in victory.

lines.white_explanation: Having defeated the enemy, some beat drums in pursuit, some celebrate victory; when news arrives, some weep with tears of joy, others sing loudly.

lines.explanation: The moon nearly full. The team of horses vanishes. No blame.

image.text: The horses are lost, one must be doubly vigilant afterward.
image.explanation: The horses are lost, one must be doubly vigilant to prevent similar incidents from recurring.

lines.white_explanation: At mid-month, the horses are lost, but there is no major disaster.

lines.explanation: He has truth that binds. No blame.

image.text: He has truth that binds, his position is correct.
image.explanation: Having a sincere heart, remaining consistent, just as the Nine in the Fifth position shows, his actions align with his position.

lines.white_explanation: Captives in groups, tied and bound together. No disaster.

lines.explanation: The call of the bird ascending to heaven. Persistence brings misfortune.

image.text: The call of the bird ascending to heaven, how can this last long?

daxiang: Zhong Fu means sincerity and trust; wind blowing over lake water causes the lake to respond with waves, symbolizing resonance.
fortune: Dealing with people with 'sincerity' and handling affairs with 'trust' will bring good fortune in all matters; harboring evil thoughts brings misfortune.
career: With an honest and faithful attitude toward your career, you will achieve significant success and smooth development. You must continue to follow the principles of the right path, not become careless, and not be overly trusting of others, especially avoiding self-isolation due to arrogance. Otherwise, your career will head toward failure.
business: Handling matters well, meeting market demands. With careful management, maintaining integrity, providing quality service, you can achieve satisfactory results, and even taking risks will not cause problems.
fame: You must build on the foundation of moral cultivation, study knowledge and skills diligently, and continuously improve yourself. At the same time, do not fear difficulties, and strive forward.
love: Both parties treat each other with sincerity, resulting in happiness and fulfillment.
advice: Use sincerity as the cornerstone of your life, be genuine with others, honor regulations, uphold principles, remain harmonious and humble, and you can overcome any difficulty; even if problems arise, you can remedy the situation. But you must enhance your ability to observe people and improve your discernment of right and wrong.
health: A close call without danger.

name: Xiao Guo

kingWen.explanation: Success, favorable for persistence. Small matters may be done, but not great ones. The flying bird leaves a message: It is not good to ascend, it is good to descend. Great good fortune.

image.text: Thunder on the mountain, Xiao Guo. The superior person in conduct exceeds in courtesy, in mourning exceeds in grief, and in expenditure exceeds in frugality.
image.explanation: Thunder on the mountain, Xiao Guo. The superior person in conduct exceeds in courtesy, in mourning exceeds in grief, and in expenditure exceeds in frugality.

traditional.description: This hexagram is formed from different trigrams (lower Gen over upper Zhen). Gen represents mountain, Zhen represents thunder, thunder over the mountain, one cannot help but be fearful. Yang represents big, Yin represents small. The four outer yin lines exceed the two middle yang lines, hence the name 'Xiao Guo', where 'small' slightly exceeds.

lines.explanation: The flying bird brings misfortune.

image.text: The flying bird brings misfortune, nothing can be done about it.
image.explanation: The flying bird passing overhead portends misfortune, this is something that cannot be helped.

lines.white_explanation: The flying bird passing overhead portends misfortune.

lines.explanation: She passes by her grandfather and meets her grandmother. He does not reach his lord but meets his minister. No blame.

image.text: Not reaching his lord, as ministers should not exceed.
image.explanation: Not reaching the ruler because it is inappropriate for ministers to exceed their ruler.

lines.white_explanation: Missing his grandfather but meeting his grandmother; not reaching the ruler but meeting his ministers. Though there is delay, it is not in vain, thus no disaster.

lines.explanation: If you do not prevent excess, someone may come and attack. Misfortune.

image.text: Someone may attack, how unfortunate!
image.explanation: Allowing indulgence that harms him, the misfortune is extreme, beyond words.

lines.white_explanation: Do not excessively criticize, but stop his mistakes from developing. If allowed to continue unchecked, it will harm him, resulting in misfortune.

lines.explanation: No blame. Not passing by, meeting him. Going brings danger, must be cautious. Do not act. Be perpetually firm.

image.text: Not passing by, meeting him, the position is inappropriate. Going brings danger, must be cautious, cannot last long.
image.explanation: Do not excessively criticize, but prevent mistakes, because the Nine in the Fourth yang line is in a yin position, like someone in an unfavorable situation, prone to errors. Proceeding into danger requires warning, because knowingly continuing will only accelerate failure.

lines.white_explanation: No fault, do not criticize him, but prevent mistakes from happening. Proceeding into danger requires immediate warning; no need to divine future fortune.

lines.explanation: Dense clouds but no rain from our western suburbs. The prince shoots and captures the prey in the cave.

image.text: Dense clouds but no rain, it is already above.
image.explanation: Dense cloud cover, rain imminent, because rain clouds have gathered in the sky.

lines.white_explanation: In the sky above our western suburbs, dense cloud cover, rain imminent. The prince went to shoot birds but caught wild beasts in a cave.

lines.explanation: Not meeting but passing by. The flying bird leaves it. Misfortune. This is called calamity.

image.text: Not meeting but passing by, already at the extreme.
image.explanation: Not restraining and thus making mistakes, just as the Top Six yin line position shows, this person is too arrogant.

lines.white_explanation: Not restraining, thus making mistakes, like a flying bird caught in a net, misfortune! This is called disaster.

daxiang: Thunder on a mountain; though the thunder is loud, it's blocked by the mountain, reducing its sound – this is 'Small Excess'.
fortune: All matters are unfavorable; small affairs are suitable, great matters unsuitable. Be especially wary of small mistakes causing disturbance and bringing disputes.
career: Actions should be cautious and careful, avoid risk-taking, especially avoid taking shortcuts. But as long as you persist in proper conduct, you can bravely move forward, work hard, and develop your career. However, you must maintain proper limits, avoid reaching too high, to prevent disaster. Adapting to changing circumstances is key.
business: You don't fully grasp market conditions; you may test them briefly, then quickly withdraw. Otherwise, danger will result. You should not act on a large scale, nor should you be timid. Build steadily and develop step by step.
fame: You should follow the principles of moderation and the logic of progressive advancement to achieve steady progress. Do not pursue empty fame, and especially do not seek high positions regardless of actual conditions.
love: You should spend a relatively long time understanding each other; do not act hastily.
advice: Actions must maintain proper limits and know when to stop. In times of prosperity, prevent excesses and reign yourself in promptly. Excess will not accomplish things but will instead invite calamity. All actions must be flexible and adaptable, not stubborn.
health: Either too cold or too hot.

name: Ji Ji

kingWen.explanation: Success in small matters. Beneficial to be steadfast. Good at the beginning, disorder at the end.

image.text: Water above fire, Ji Ji. The superior person contemplates potential problems and prepares for them in advance.
image.explanation: Water above fire, Ji Ji. The superior person contemplates potential problems and prepares for them in advance.

traditional.description: This hexagram is formed from different trigrams (lower Li over upper Kan). Kan represents water, Li represents fire, water and fire interact, with water above fire, water's force overpowering fire's force, the great work of extinguishing fire is completed. Ji means already; Ji means completed. Ji Ji means affairs have already been completed successfully, but changes will eventually occur.

lines.explanation: Dragging its wheels, wetting its tail, no blame.

image.text: Dragging its wheels, rightfully without blame.
image.explanation: Holding up one's belt while crossing the river, getting the hem wet, rightly without disaster.

lines.white_explanation: Holding up one's belt while crossing the river, getting the hem wet. No major problem.

lines.explanation: A woman loses her head covering, do not pursue it, it will be found in seven days.

image.text: Found within seven days, due to following the middle path.
image.explanation: It can be found without searching within seven days, because the Six in the Second Place is a yin line in a yin position, the position symbolizes gain, so the lost item will return.

lines.white_explanation: A woman loses her head covering, no need to search for it, it can be found without searching within seven days.

lines.explanation: Emperor Gaozong attacked the Devil Country, conquering it after three years. Inferior people should not be employed.

image.text: Conquering it after three years, due to exhaustion.
image.explanation: Being anxious all day long indicates deep concerns and doubts.

lines.white_explanation: Emperor Gaozong attacked the Devil Country, taking three years to defeat it. When encountering this line, do not heavily employ inferior people.

lines.explanation: Sailing in a leaky boat stuffed with rags, remaining vigilant all day.

image.text: Remaining vigilant all day, due to suspicion.
image.explanation: Being anxious all day long indicates deep concerns and doubts.

lines.white_explanation: Sailing in a boat patched with worn-out cloth, being anxious all day long.

lines.explanation: Eastern neighbors slaughter an ox, not as good as the modest sacrifice of western neighbors, who truly receive the blessing.

image.text: Eastern neighbors slaughter an ox, not as timely as the western neighbors. Truly receiving the blessing, great good fortune will come.
image.explanation: The Yin people's lavish ox sacrifices to spirits are not as good as the Zhou people's modest sacrifices, which show better intentions. The Zhou people receive the spirits' blessings, with significant good fortune to come.

lines.white_explanation: The Yin people's lavish ox sacrifices to spirits are not as good as the Zhou people's modest sacrifices. The Zhou people instead receive the spirits' blessings.

lines.explanation: Wetting one's head, dangerous.

image.text: Wetting one's head is dangerous, how can it last long?
image.explanation: Water splashing on one's head, how can one remain there for long?

lines.white_explanation: Wading across the river, water splashing on one's head, dangerous.

daxiang: Kan water above Li fire, water naturally flows downward, fire naturally rises upward, water and fire assisting each other. The meaning of completion.
fortune: Achieving both fame and wealth, a sign of success, beware that extremes lead to reversal, good at the beginning, dangerous at the end.
career: You are in a smooth and prosperous stage, perhaps even with great accomplishments. The key question is how to maintain this momentum. You must recognize the truth that prosperity leads to decline, always think ahead about potential problems, prevent issues before they grow, and prepare for the unexpected. At the same time, you must pay close attention to the situation, seize favorable opportunities, continue to work hard, and push career development forward.
business: Due to favorable market conditions, you have already earned a lot. But this also indicates potential crises that could appear at any time. Therefore, you must be careful and attentive, prevent problems before they arise, and remain vigilant and cautious all day. Meanwhile, carefully observe market changes, pivot when necessary, and develop new markets.
fame: The basic conditions for personal pursuit of fame and wealth are already in place. You must prevent becoming rigid and conservative as a result, which could lead to failure at the last moment and abandoning halfway.
love: Smooth at the beginning, obstacles will appear midway.
advice: All conditions are favorable, and the environment is conducive to growth. But because of this, you might become complacent, stop advancing, or even become decadent and trend toward decline. You must continue to work hard diligently, maintain the virtue of humility, always harbor a sense of unease, and prevent unexpected events from occurring.
health: Recovering from serious illness, still need self-care.

name: Wei Ji

kingWen.explanation: Success. The small fox has almost crossed the river, but its tail gets wet. Nothing is advantageous.

image.text: Fire above water, Wei Ji. The superior person carefully distinguishes things and dwells in the proper place.
image.explanation: Fire above water, Wei Ji. The superior person carefully distinguishes things and dwells in the proper place.

traditional.description: This hexagram is formed from different trigrams (lower Kan over upper Li). Li is fire, Kan is water. Fire above, water below, fire's force overpowers water's force, the great work of extinguishing fire is not yet completed, hence the name Wei Ji. The I Ching begins with the Qian and Kun hexagrams, and ends with the Ji Ji and Wei Ji hexagrams, fully reflecting the idea of change and development.

lines.explanation: Wetting its tail, regrettable.

image.text: Wetting its tail, also not knowing the limit.
image.explanation: Wading across the river, getting one's hem wet. Foreseeing the greater from the smaller, continuing to take risks shows no awareness of caution.

lines.white_explanation: Wading across the river, getting one's hem wet, progress is difficult.

lines.explanation: Dragging its wheels, persistence brings good fortune.

image.text: Nine in the Second Place brings good fortune through persistence, acting correctly through the middle path.
image.explanation: The Nine in the Second Place speaks of good fortune through persistence, because the Nine in the Second Place is a yang line in the middle position of the lower trigram, like someone whose actions follow the correct path.

lines.white_explanation: Holding up one's belt while wading across the river. The divination brings a favorable omen.

lines.explanation: Before completion, going forward brings misfortune. It is advantageous to cross the great river.

image.text: Before completion, going forward brings misfortune, the position is inappropriate.
image.explanation: Unable to cross the river, journeying brings danger, because the Six in the Third Place is a yin line in a yang position, like someone in an unfavorable situation.

lines.white_explanation: Unable to cross the river, journeying brings danger. Not advantageous for wading across rivers.

lines.explanation: Persistence brings good fortune, regret disappears. Use shock to attack the Devil Country. In three years, rewards come from the great country.

image.text: Persistence brings good fortune, regret disappears, the will is fulfilled.
image.explanation: Favorable divination, no regrets, indicating that one's will is fulfilled.

lines.white_explanation: Favorable divination. No regrets. Taking great military action, helping Yin attack the Devil Country, taking three years to defeat it, receiving rewards from the Yin country.

lines.explanation: Persistence brings good fortune, no regret. The superior person's brightness. There is truth, good fortune.

image.text: The superior person's brightness, its light brings good fortune.
image.explanation: The superior person's glory, the superior person is upright and open, naturally bringing good fortune.

lines.white_explanation: Favorable divination, no regrets. Winning the battle, capturing prisoners, this is the superior person's glory, bringing good fortune.

lines.explanation: Having sincerity in drinking wine, no blame. Wetting one's head. Having sincerity, this is lost.

image.text: Drinking wine and wetting one's head, also not knowing moderation.
image.explanation: Drinking excessively and causing trouble until one's hair is soaked, showing lack of self-control.

lines.white_explanation: Capturing prisoners, drinking wine in celebration. No disaster. But drinking excessively and causing trouble, with hair becoming soaked. The prisoners take the opportunity to rebel, and are killed.

daxiang: Water naturally flows downward, fire naturally moves upward, water and fire do not interact, yin and yang are not in their correct positions, meaning incompletion and lack of success.
fortune: Luck is poor, but with patience to break through difficulties, success can eventually come, showing a pattern of misfortune at first followed by good fortune.
career: You are at the final critical moment, success or failure is imminent. Therefore, you must not become careless. Self-discipline is very important; persevering to the end, and when necessary, cautiously taking moderate risks, can lead to career success.
business: The market is on the eve of major changes, and the prospects are not yet clear. This is the most difficult period; you must keep a cool head, avoid risks, not act excessively, practice moderate restraint, observe trends, and then decide on action.
fame: Long-term effort and pursuit will soon show results. At the critical moment of success or failure, you should remain calm and composed, accept fate, and follow the natural course.
love: You have already passed through the difficult stage; with careful additional effort, there will be a satisfying outcome.
advice: This hexagram means 'incomplete', indicating unlimited potential and full development possibilities. Therefore, you must adhere to the principle of correctness, and with wisdom, moderation, sincerity, and humility, achieve your career. Facing life, you can only work diligently, do your utmost as a person, accept heaven's will, and not overly calculate success or failure.
health: Blood circulation is poor, be cautious with medication.
